alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 6:41PM EDT until May 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Pulaski and Rockcastle. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Vernon, Hansford, Sand Springs, Wabp, Level Green, Bloss, Bromo, Wellhope, Pongo, Spiro, Maretburg, Burr, Luner, Willailla, Quail, Sand Hill, Lake Linville, Renfro Valley, Pine Hill and Ottowa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
